quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Author and Comedian
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, people, bears. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Name the author of The Lady or the Tiger, The Magic Egg, Mr. Tolmin and The Widows Curse?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Frank R. Stockton

questions.question: Who wrote the short stories Taras Bulba, The Cloak, the Colash, The Overcoat, Why the Two Ivans Quarrelled?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nikolai V. Gogol

questions.question: The Tell -Tale Heart, The Murder in the Rue Morgue, The Mystery of Marie Roget, The Pit and the Pendulum, The Purloined Letter are short stories by this author.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edgar Allen Poe

questions.question: Who wrote Bartleby the Scrivener, Billy Budd Foretopman and The Piazza?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Herman Melville

questions.question: Who wrote Young Goodman Brown, Wakefield, Rappaccinis Daughter and Mr. Bullfrog?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nathaniel Hawthorne

questions.question: This comedienne who said Sometimes I feel like a figment of my own imagination.  is one of the handful of early women to pave the way for future aspiring funny women.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lily Tomlin

questions.question: Name the author of The Legend of Sleepy Hollow and Little Britain.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Washington Irving

questions.question: This comedian complained of having an apartment infested with Koala Bears. It was the cutest infestation, ever!
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mitch Hedberg

questions.question: Which Comedian made this quip: Boycott shampoo! Demand the REAL poo!?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Steven Wright

questions.question: The Emperors New Clothes, The Red Shoes, The Snow Queen, The Real Princess are fairy tales written by this author.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hans Christian Anderson

questions.question: This chronically smoking comedian put his audience in place with this line Non-smokers die every day. Sleep tight!
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bill Hicks

questions.question: Name the author of A Dogs Tale, The  Notorios Jumpoing Frog of Calaveras County, The True Story.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mark Twain

questions.question: This comedian calls himself an Executive Transvestite whilst asking the question Cake or Death?!
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eddie Izzard

questions.question: Who penned the short stories The Cask of Amontillado, The Fall of the House of Usher, The Blue Coat and X-ing a Paragrab?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edgar Allen Poe

questions.question: Standing ovations have become far too commonplace. What we need are ovations where the audience members all punch and kick one another. “ was said by which unapologetic satirist?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Carlin

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: U.s. and Police
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, officers, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What does the 1st Amendment of the U.S. Constitution guarantee?

options.text: To be free of illegal searches

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Right to free speech

questions.question: When there is reason to believe that a domestic assault has occurred (example: husband hitting wife) the police in the U.S. must do which of the following?

options.text: Have a judge approve the arrest
Take the victim to the hospital for an exam

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Arrest the aggressor

questions.question: This blood alcohol content level is generally accepted by all 50 U.S. states as the level consistent with being legally intoxicated.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: .10

questions.question: U.S. police officers can shoot a man running from a felony he committed if he is running away with a gun.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Elizabeth Bowes-Lyon, the mother of Queen Elizabeth II, was born where?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: England

questions.question: Queen Elizabeth II gave birth to how many children?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 4

questions.question: How is Queen Elizabeth II related to Edward VIII, the late Duke of Windsor?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was her uncle.

questions.question: How was the late Earl of Mountbatten related to Prince Philip.

options.text: He was Prince Philips great grandson.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was Prince Philips uncle.

questions.question: In the U.S. a person under the age of 17 cannot be tried as an adult.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: This case allowed police officers to pat down people for weapons without violating the 4th Amendment of the U.S. constitution.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Terry v. Ohio

questions.question: What Amendment of the U.S. Constitution guarantees the right to be presumed innocent until proven guilty?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 5th

questions.question: All arrestees are read this warning before questioning due to the case with the same name.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Miranda

questions.question: Bail and bond are synonymous.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Who is the author of The Canterville Ghost, The Model Millionaire, The Happy Prince and The Remarkable Rocket?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oscar Wilde

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true about the Life Imprisonment sentence in the U.S.?

options.text: You stay in prison until you die.
You are executed after all of your appeals have run out.
You are given a 100-year prison sentence
You stay in prison for 25 years and are then eligible for a parole hearing.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: You stay in prison for 25 years and are then eligible for a parole hearing.

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Plays and Playwright
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, birds, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who penned the plays The Emperor Jones, Mourning Becomes Electra, Anna Christie, Desire Under the Elms, beyond the Horizon, and The Iceman Cometh?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eugene ONeill

questions.question: Come Back Little Sheba, Picnic and Bus Stop are plays by this dramatist.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Inge

questions.question: As a young man, Vlad the Impaler was taken hostage by the Turks and sent to Istanbul.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Both Queen Elizabeth II and Prince Philip are direct descendants of Queen Victoria.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: This playwright is the author of Our Town, The Skin of Our Teeth, Bernice, and The Merchant of Yonkers.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thornton Wilder

questions.question: In which present day country was Vlad the Impaler born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Romania

questions.question: What ancient Greek tragedian wrote the plays Oedipus Rex, Antigone, Oedipus at Colonus, Ajax?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sophocles

questions.question: What prominent playwright wrote the plays A Glass Menagerie, A Streetcar Named Desire,  The Rose Tattoo, The Night of the Iguana?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tennessee Williams

questions.question: Lysistrata, The Birds, The Wasps, The Frogs are plays by this ancient Greek playwright.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Aristophanes

questions.question: Who wrote the plays Marty, The Tenth Man and Gideon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paddy Chayefsky

questions.question: Uncommon Women and Others, The Heidi Chronicles, Isnt It Romantic, and The Sisters Rosensweig are written by this playwright.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wendy Wasserstein

questions.question: Who is the author of Agamemnon, The Libation Bearers, The Eumenides, Prometheus Bound, and Seven Against Thebes?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Aeschylus

questions.question: A Thousand Clowns, Im Not Rappaport, Thieves, Conversations with My Father are plays by this dramatist.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Herb Gardner

questions.question: Vlad Draculas father and brother were assassinated by the Turks so they could more easily invade the region of Wallachia.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Peter Phillips is the eldest grandchild of Queen Elizabeth II.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Fortune and Business
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, bourne, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: James G. March has served on the faculties of the Carnegie Institute of Technology, the University of California and Stanford University. He is a business theorists and his studies are directed towards this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Understanding risk-taking and decision-making

questions.question: Much of his fortune and rise to splendour was due to deals with William IX, who had had inherited what was purported to be among the largest fortunes in Europe. That fortune eventually went under his control. This was the start of one of the most successful German business families in the world.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mayer Amschel Rothschild

questions.question: This man played a knife wielding Bowie in a movie about the Alamo starring John Wayne.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Richard Widmark

questions.question: The tagline for this movie was: For over two thousand years, Europe has survived many great disasters. Now for the real test. Chevy Chase  his family are coming from America!“ What film is it the quote from?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: European Vacation

questions.question: He was a business tycoon who made a fortune by selling Coca-Cola. He bought the formula of Coca-Cola from its inventor John Pemberton for $2,300.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Asa Griggs Candler

questions.question: Which nickname given to Vlad Dracula means impaler?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tepes

questions.question: He is from a  prominent 400-year old German family, famous for their steel production and manufacture of ammunition and armaments. He launched the family business.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Friedrich Krupp

questions.question: He founded one of the largest fast food companies. Having amassed a $500 million fortune during his lifetime, he was  included in the TIME 100 list of the worlds most influential builders and titans of industry.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ray Kroc

questions.question: He was the most famous Greek shipping magnate of the 20th century.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Aristotle Onassis

questions.question: This Australian-born tycoon is regarded as one of the most politically influential media proprietors in the world. He started his business in Australia and exported it to Britain and the USA.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rupert Murdoch

questions.question: He was born in Canada and was a business tycoon as well as a politician. He bought and later sold control of the Rolls-Royce automobile company and built a London newspaper empire. Who is he?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Max Aitken, 1st Baron Beaverbrook

questions.question: He is an American businessman, who studied at the University of Texas at Austin with the intention to become a physicist. It was then, that he got interested in computers and even started a computer company called PCs Limited in his dorm room. The company soon became very prosperous.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Michael Dell

questions.question: This Dick starred as Tom Bradford on Eight is Enough.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Van Patton

questions.question: This Richard played Jason Bourne in the original 1988 Bourne Identity.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chamberlain

questions.question: Notes from a Small Island is a travel book by an American Bill Bryson, describing a European island. Which one?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Great Britain

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Musician and Album
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, john, actor. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: St. David, who is commemorated with a feast day falling on March 1 each year, is the national patron saint of this country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wales

questions.question: John F. Kennedy studied at all of these schools except one.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: United States Military Academy (West Point)

questions.question: This Jessica is a Country music singer famous for her 2001 song Who Am I .
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jessica Andrews

questions.question: One of the actors starring in Friends graduated from Vassar College with a Bachelor of Science degree in Biology.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lisa Kudrow

questions.question: In 2008, late-night talk show host David Letterman was accused of sexism regarding remarks about this politician.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sarah Palin

questions.question: In 2007, English soccer player David Beckham, whose fame has extended well beyond sport, joined what American Major League Soccer team?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Los Angeles Galaxy

questions.question: John Adams was the second President of the United States. He was educated in the field of law at this Ivy League university.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harvard University

questions.question: Hollywood star Brad Pitt attended the University of Missouri, where he studied this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Journalism

questions.question: What musician recorded the album White Snake and later used the album title as the name of his future band?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: David Coverdale

questions.question: What weapon did young David, the future king of Israel, use to defeat the giant Goliath?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a sling

questions.question: American magician and illusionist David Copperfield named himself after a character created by what classic author?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charles Dickens

questions.question: What actor won the 1996 Golden Globe Award for his role of an FBI Special Agent in a TV series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: David Duchovny

questions.question: What musician created the Ziggy Stardust persona, featured in the 1972 concept album The Rise and Fall of Ziggy Stardust and the Spiders from Mars?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: David Bowie

questions.question: The publication of this novel by David Herbert Lawrence caused a scandal as it contained four-letter words and described the relationship between a working-class male and an upper-class female.

options.text: Fanny Hill or Memoirs of a Woman of Pleasure

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lady Chatterleys Lover

questions.question: What musician is not correctly matched with the band of which he was a member?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: David Bowie - Talking Heads

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Mahatma Gandhi and University
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, actor, leader. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Actor Hugh Grant studied English at the University of Cambridge.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What was the astrological sign of Indian spiritual leader Mahatma Gandhi?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Libra

questions.question: Bill Gates graduated from Harvard University.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In 1894, the Natal Indian Congress was founded by Mahatma Gandhi in South Africa, for what purpose?

options.text: To organize the Indian people in London.
To fight with the discrimination against Indians.
To spread the teachings of Buddha.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: To fight with the discrimination against Indians.

questions.question: On March 10, 1922 Mahatma Gandhi was sentenced to 6 years of prison for sedition but he served only two years. Why?

options.text: Because the UN forced the British government to free him.
Because he was later found not guilty.
Because his followers helped him escape from prison.
Because he needed urgent medical treatment.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Because he needed urgent medical treatment.

questions.question: At first Condoleezza Rices plans were to become a pianist. However, after she attended a course on international politics taught by this person, she changed her mind and at age 19, Rice earned her bachelors degree in political science from the University of Denver.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Josef Korbel

questions.question: During World War I, the famous spiritual leader Mahatma Gandhi encouraged the Indian people to do what?

options.text: To join the army and support the British.
To stay home and never take part in a war.
To join the army and fight against the British.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: To join the army and support the British.

questions.question: Famous Indian spiritual leader Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi is widely known as Mahatma, which means what  in Sanskrit?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Great Soul

questions.question: In 1889, what professional education did Mahatma Gandhi receive at University College in London?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He became a barrister.

questions.question: Before altering the course of his career towards drama, this actor received a masters degree in chemical engineering from the University of Sydney, and was eventually awarded a prestigious Fulbright scholarship to MIT.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dolph Lundgren

questions.question: What is the title of Mahatma Gandhis autobiography, originally written in the Gujarati language?

options.text: The Story of My Experiments with Truth

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Story of My Experiments with Truth

questions.question: What was the main principle in Mahatma Gandhis philosophical teaching Satyagraha, which he employed in his fight against the apartheid in South Africa and the British Raj?

options.text: The war to end all wars

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The non-violent protest

questions.question: During World War II, Mahatma Gandhi organized this movement of civil disobedience, determined to achieve Indias total independence from the British.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Quit India Movement

questions.question: Which one of these British Prime Ministers studied chemistry at the University of Oxford?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Margaret Thatcher

questions.question: The famous New York real estate developer, Donald Trump, earned his bachelors degree in economics from this university.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: University of Pennsylvania
